member.name: T:Discord.Commands.AliasAttribute
member.summary: Marks the aliases for a command.
member.remarks: This attribute allows a command to have one or multiple aliases. In other words, the base command can have multiple aliases when triggering the command itself, giving the end-user more freedom of choices when giving hot-words to trigger the desired command. See the example for a better illustration.

member.name: P:Discord.Commands.AliasAttribute.Aliases
member.summary: Gets the aliases which have been defined for the command.

member.name: M:Discord.Commands.AliasAttribute.#ctor(System.String[])
member.summary: Creates a new with the given aliases.

member.name: T:Discord.Commands.CommandAttribute
member.summary: Marks the execution information for a command.

member.name: P:Discord.Commands.CommandAttribute.Text
member.summary: Gets the text that has been set to be recognized as a command.

member.name: P:Discord.Commands.CommandAttribute.RunMode
member.summary: Specifies the of the command. This affects how the command is executed.

member.name: M:Discord.Commands.CommandAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new attribute with the specified name.
member.param: The name of the command.

member.name: T:Discord.Commands.DontAutoLoadAttribute
member.summary: Prevents the marked module from being loaded automatically.
member.remarks: This attribute tells to ignore the marked module from being loaded automatically (e.g. the method). If a non-public module marked with this attribute is attempted to be loaded manually, the loading process will also fail.

member.name: T:Discord.Commands.DontInjectAttribute
member.summary: Prevents the marked property from being injected into a module.
member.remarks: This attribute prevents the marked member from being injected into its parent module. Useful when you have a public property that you do not wish to invoke the library's dependency injection service.

member.name: T:Discord.Commands.GroupAttribute
member.summary: Marks the module as a command group.

member.name: P:Discord.Commands.GroupAttribute.Prefix
member.summary: Gets the prefix set for the module.

member.name: M:Discord.Commands.GroupAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new with the provided prefix.
member.param: The prefix of the module group.

member.name: T:Discord.Commands.NameAttribute
member.summary: Marks the public name of a command, module, or parameter.

member.name: P:Discord.Commands.NameAttribute.Text
member.summary: Gets the name of the command.

member.name: M:Discord.Commands.NameAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Marks the public name of a command, module, or parameter with the provided name.
member.param: The public name of the object.

member.name: T:Discord.Commands.NamedArgumentTypeAttribute
member.summary: Instructs the command system to treat command parameters of this type as a collection of named arguments matching to its properties.

member.name: T:Discord.Commands.OverrideTypeReaderAttribute
member.summary: Marks the to be read by the specified .
member.remarks:
This attribute will override the to be used when parsing for the desired type in the command. This is useful when one wishes to use a particular without affecting other commands that are using the same target type.
If the given type reader does not inherit from , an will be thrown.

member.name: P:Discord.Commands.OverrideTypeReaderAttribute.TypeReader
member.summary: Gets the specified of the parameter.

member.name: M:Discord.Commands.OverrideTypeReaderAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.param: The to be used with the parameter.
member.exception: The given does not inherit from .

member.name: T:Discord.Commands.ParameterPreconditionAttribute
member.summary: Requires the parameter to pass the specified precondition before execution can begin.

member.name: M:Discord.Commands.ParameterPreconditionAttribute.CheckPermissionsAsync(Discord.Commands.ICommandContext,Discord.Commands.ParameterInfo,System.Object,System.IServiceProvider)
member.summary: Checks whether the condition is met before execution of the command.
member.param: The context of the command.
The parameter of the command being checked against.
The raw value of the parameter.
The service collection used for dependency injection.

member.name: T:Discord.Commands.PreconditionAttribute
member.summary: Requires the module or class to pass the specified precondition before execution can begin.

member.name: P:Discord.Commands.PreconditionAttribute.Group
member.summary: Specifies a group that this precondition belongs to.
member.remarks: of the same group require only one of the preconditions to pass in order to be successful (A || B). Specifying = null or not at all will require *all* preconditions to pass, just like normal (A && B).

member.name: P:Discord.Commands.PreconditionAttribute.ErrorMessage
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, uses the supplied string as the error message if the precondition doesn't pass. Setting this for a class that doesn't override this property is a no-op.

member.name: M:Discord.Commands.PreconditionAttribute.CheckPermissionsAsync(Discord.Commands.ICommandContext,Discord.Commands.CommandInfo,System.IServiceProvider)
member.summary: Checks if the has the sufficient permission to be executed.
member.param: The context of the command.
The command being executed.
The service collection used for dependency injection.

member.summary: Requires the bot to have a specific permission in the channel a command is invoked in.

member.summary: Gets the specified of the precondition.

member.name: P:Discord.Commands.RequireBotPermissionAttribute.ChannelPermission
member.summary: Gets the specified of the precondition.

member.name: P:Discord.Commands.RequireBotPermissionAttribute.NotAGuildErrorMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets the error message if the precondition fails due to being run outside of a Guild channel.

member.name: M:Discord.Commands.RequireBotPermissionAttribute.#ctor(Discord.GuildPermission)
member.summary: Requires the bot account to have a specific .
member.remarks: This precondition will always fail if the command is being invoked in a .
member.param: The that the bot must have. Multiple permissions can be specified by ORing the permissions together.

member.name: M:Discord.Commands.RequireBotPermissionAttribute.#ctor(Discord.ChannelPermission)
member.summary: Requires that the bot account to have a specific .
member.param: The that the bot must have. Multiple permissions can be specified by ORing the permissions together.

member.summary: Defines the type of command context (i.e. where the command is being executed).

member.summary: Specifies the command to be executed within a guild.

member.name: F:Discord.Commands.ContextType.DM
member.summary: Specifies the command to be executed within a DM.

member.name: F:Discord.Commands.ContextType.Group
member.summary: Specifies the command to be executed within a group.

member.name: T:Discord.Commands.RequireContextAttribute
member.summary: Requires the command to be invoked in a specified context (e.g. in guild, DM).

member.name: P:Discord.Commands.RequireContextAttribute.Contexts
member.summary: Gets the context required to execute the command.

member.name: M:Discord.Commands.RequireContextAttribute.#ctor(Discord.Commands.ContextType)
member.summary: Requires the command to be invoked in the specified context.
member.param: The type of context the command can be invoked in. Multiple contexts can be specified by ORing the contexts together.

member.name: T:Discord.Commands.RequireNsfwAttribute
member.summary: Requires the command to be invoked in a channel marked NSFW.
member.remarks: The precondition will restrict the access of the command or module to be accessed within a guild channel that has been marked as mature or NSFW. If the channel is not of type or the channel is not marked as NSFW, the precondition will fail with an erroneous .

member.name: T:Discord.Commands.RequireOwnerAttribute
member.summary: Requires the command to be invoked by the owner of the bot.
member.remarks:
This precondition will restrict the access of the command or module to the owner of the Discord application. If the precondition fails to be met, an erroneous will be returned with the message "Command can only be run by the owner of the bot."
This precondition will only work if the account has a of ;otherwise, this precondition will always fail.

member.name: T:Discord.Commands.RequireUserPermissionAttribute
member.summary: Requires the user invoking the command to have a specified permission.

member.summary: Gets the specified of the precondition.

member.summary: Gets the specified of the precondition.

member.summary: Gets or sets the error message if the precondition fails due to being run outside of a Guild channel.

member.summary: Requires that the user invoking the command to have a specific .
member.remarks: This precondition will always fail if the command is being invoked in a .
member.param: The that the user must have. Multiple permissions can be specified by ORing the permissions together.

member.name: M:Discord.Commands.RequireUserPermissionAttribute.#ctor(Discord.ChannelPermission)
member.summary: Requires that the user invoking the command to have a specific .
member.param: The that the user must have. Multiple permissions can be specified by ORing the permissions together.

member.name: T:Discord.Commands.CommandService
member.summary: Provides a framework for building Discord commands.

remarks.para: The service provides a framework for building Discord commands both dynamically via runtime builders or statically via compile-time modules. To create a command module at compile-time, see (most common); otherwise, see .
This service also provides several events for monitoring command usages; such as for any command-related log events, and for information about commands that have been successfully executed.

member.name: E:Discord.Commands.CommandService.Log
member.summary: Occurs when a command-related information is received.

member.name: E:Discord.Commands.CommandService.CommandExecuted
member.summary: Occurs when a command is executed.
member.remarks: This event is fired when a command has been executed, successfully or not. When a command fails to execute during parsing or precondition stage, the CommandInfo may not be returned.

member.summary: Gets or sets the that separates an argument with another.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether commands should be case-sensitive.

member.name: P:Discord.Commands.CommandServiceConfig.ThrowOnError
member.summary: Gets or sets whether commands should push exceptions up to the caller.

member.name: P:Discord.Commands.CommandServiceConfig.QuotationMarkAliasMap
member.summary: Collection of aliases for matching pairs of string delimiters. The dictionary stores the opening delimiter as a key, and the matching closing delimiter as the value. If no value is supplied will be used, which contains many regional equivalents. Only values that are specified in this map will be used as string delimiters, so if " is removed then it won't be used. If this map is set to null or empty, the default delimiter of " will be used.

member.name: T:Discord.Commands.ChannelTypeReader`1
member.summary: A for parsing objects implementing .
member.remarks: This is shipped with Discord.Net and is used by default to parse any implemented object within a command. The TypeReader will attempt to first parse the input by mention, then the snowflake identifier, then by name; the highest candidate will be chosen as the final output; otherwise, an erroneous is returned.
member.typeparam: The type to be checked; must implement .
